column4: Erm... Bittorrent seems to be blocked by something, and it's always yellow-lighted... On windows, I had to go into a port forwarding thing to make it work, and it uses the same ports on linux... but it doesn't seem to be working? :3
you'll have to go through port-forwarding again.  your IP address is probably different in ubuntu
don't download firestarter - it won't help you
do you remember how you set up the windows box?  did you set a fixed internal IP address when you were doing the port forwarding setup?
there was a set up program, and then there's like this website thing for the port forwarding.
do you intend to use the Windows box and the ubuntu box at the same time?  Or is it a single dual-boot box?
so this is what you need to do:
boot into XP, find out what IP address it uses on your LAN, then boot into ubuntu and set it to use the same IP address
or, if you like, to avoid booting into XP, look at the router's port-forwarding config, and see where it's currently forwarding bittorrent packets to, and set your IP address to match
how do I do the IP address setting part?
you click on 'system' at the top of the screen, then 'admin', then 'networking'
then select your network interface, click properties, select 'static' in configuration and supply the other fields it asks for
could it have anything to do with the hostname of my linux partition being different than the XP partition?
it could, indeed, depending on how your router decides where to forward the packets to.
of course, you can use a different port for the ubuntu OS if you want to
bittorrent will run on any port you like - it doesn't have to be 6881
